Solar Engineering Basics
Solar PV Engineering Basics: - Curtailment occurs when generation exceeds grid capacity or market
demand. - Key factors: inverter limits, grid congestion, ramp-rate limits, protection settings. - Rule:
Operating DC/AC ratio influences clipping and curtailment profiles. - Recommended: Monitor
irradiance, backfeed limits, and thermal constraints.

Grid Code Requirements
Grid Code Requirements Summary: - Reactive power support must be maintained within Q-V curve
limits. - Frequency-Watt and Volt-Watt responses mandatory for grid stability. - Curtailment may be
operator■mandated during congestion or contingency events.

Bess Operations Manual
BESS Operational Guidelines: - Optimal SoC window: 20%–80% for cycle life maximization. -
Charge/discharge efficiency affected by C-rate and temperature. - Curtailment mitigation strategy:
absorb excess PV into storage with predictive dispatch.
